latex:
Let $P$ units be the increase in the circumference of a circle resulting from an increase in $\pi$ units in the diameter.  Then $P$ equals:\\
\\
$\textbf{(A)}\ \dfrac{1}{\pi}  \qquad
\textbf{(B)}\  \pi \qquad
\textbf{(C)}\  \dfrac{\pi^2}{2} \qquad
\textbf{(D)}\   \pi^2 \qquad
\textbf{(E)}\  2\pi $
